body.p:
There are two basic use cases for generating DTDs:
Generating just DTD document type shells from RELAX NG document type shells.
Generating DTD document type shells and DTD vocabulary and constraint modules for non-OASIS-provided modules (e.g., your own specializations or constraints).

RELAX NG document type shells are about as easy to create as it's possible for DITA document type shells to be. Generating DTDs from them makes it about as easy as it can be to create your own DTD document type shells.

RELAX NG vocabulary and constraint modules are of course more involved but are still easier to create and maintain than their DTD or XSD equivalent, simply because RELAX NG is an easier-to-use syntax than either DTD or XSD.

Unless you are a member of the OASIS DITA Technical Committee, you should never have a need to generate or regenerate any of the OASIS-provided vocabulary or constraint modules, which should never be modified by anyone except members of the Technical Committee (and only then at the express direction of the Committee itself).
